publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3713 Pauline McNeill: Job Losses in Scottish Newspapersâ€”That the Parliament notes with concern the plans for cuts across their range of newspapers by Trinity Mirror plc; notes that whilst their advertising levels have dropped they recently announced a 20% rise in profits; wishes to show support for the position of the National Union of Journalists, who oppose further cuts in editorial budgets, and recognises that daily and weekly newspapers are the lifeblood of the community and that it wishes to remind Trinity Mirror plc that there are responsibilities attached to owning newspapers.
S2M-3713 Job Losses in Scottish Newspapers (lodged on 9 December 2005) Dr Elaine Murray*, Margaret Jamieson*, Patrick Harvie*, Eleanor Scott*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Brian Adam*, Marlyn Glen*

S2M-3713 Job Losses in Scottish Newspapers (lodged on 9 December 2005) Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Mark Ballard*, Bill Butler*, Des McNulty*, Alex Neil*, Trish Godman*, Irene Oldfather*, Colin Fox*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S2M-3713 Job Losses in Scottish Newspapers (lodged on 9 December 2005) Sarah Boyack*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-3713 Job Losses in Scottish Newspapers (lodged on 9 December 2005) Shiona Baird*
S2M-3713 Job Losses in Scottish Newspapers (lodged on 9 December 2005) Carolyn Leckie*
